alert.note: Alert for Banks; Barrow; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson; Madison; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:33PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Barrow, central DeKalb, south central Forsyth, Gwinnett, Banks, northwestern Walton, southern Hall, Jackson, east central Fulton and western Madison Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 333 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Pinefield Crossroads to Sandy Springs, and moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Gainesville, Lawrenceville, Winder, Jefferson, Commerce, Homer, Danielsville, Peachtree Corners, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Dunwoody, Duluth, Sugar Hill, Snellville, Suwanee, Buford, Lilburn, and Loganville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Banks; Barrow; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson; Madison; Walton
